q03.question: Which of the following statements regarding symlinks and hardlinks are true?

responses.a: A hard link appears as a separate file but actually points to an existing inode.
responses.b: A soft link cannot cross partition boundaries.
responses.c: A hard link is typically slower than a soft link.
responses.d: A soft link contains the path to its target reference.
